response: The 2018 ALttP NMG Tournament concluded on July 3rd with BluntBunny taking home the title, JoshRTA in 2nd, and TGH in 3rd. Full results here: http://challonge.com/ALTTP2018/

100% collects all menu items at their max upgrade and all heart containers. NMG Wiki: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/100%25_(NMG,_No_S%2BQ) ~ Route w/Pics: https://bit.ly/2QrfLDT ~ Eri's Doc: https://bit.ly/3jJH6Nk
100% All Heart Pieces route: http://bit.ly/2RWAM5m

Japanese 1.0 is the version of ALttP most commonly used for speedrunning since the Japanese version contains less text (saves ~1 minute in NMG), and a few minor glitches like fake flippers, item dash, superspeed, and block-erase only exist in version 1.0 (saves ~30-40s in NMG).

AD is a common abbreviation for the All Dungeons RMG category, which allows some major glitches like Out of Bounds, but bans Exploration Glitch, Door Glitches, Wrong Warps, and Misslotting. Guide + Notes: http://bombch.us/DHKg
All Dungeons Theory TAS by JoshRTA: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/175287796
All Dungeons Guide + Notes: http://bombch.us/DHKg
Agah 2 Tutorial by BluntBunny: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/167608707 | Part 2: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/882043436

A technique to optimize Link's walking patterns. When walking diagonally to the north or west and at an angle of less than 45 degrees, you can mash diagonals into the air to boost pixels. Like wallpumping, this is merely a frame-saving technique in most instances, due to human limitations on mashing.

When walking east or south, Link's movement begins on the 1 pixel per frame speed of his animation. This means you do not want to reset his walking speed by wallpumping, airpumping, or stairpumping. You always want to avoid altering your input while moving south or east, as any change can slow Link down by resetting the movement sequence. Generally speaking, if you're moving south or east, you want to minimize the number of inputs you use to do so.

A backup for when you don't have swordbeams for the prize pack manipulation strat in the 3rd room of Agah Tower: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/170635873?t=22m06s

Blue balls (bb) refers to an attack Agahnim makes. This attack is undesired since it can't be repelled back at him, unlike the yellow ball (yb) attack. The first Agahnim fight consists of repeating cycles of the following five attacks: 1.[yb] 2.[yb or bb] 3.[yb or bb] 4.[yb or bb] 5.[lightning]. Agahnim is defeated after being hit by 6 yellow balls. See bb% for probabilities.
Agahnim 1 Cycle Probabilities: 2cyc=34.38% ~ 3cyc=56.64% ~ 4cyc=8.67% ~ 5cyc=0.31% ~ 6cyc=0.003%

Using the mirror while pushing a block will make it disappear. You need to be indoors but NOT in a dungeon for it to work. This minor glitch is most commonly used in the swamp dam in light world. JP v1.0 only.

Death Mountain Ascent is a way to access Death Mountain without Power Gloves using a major glitch. More info here: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Death_Mountain_Ascent ~ Video here: https://youtu.be/MI4lSfgd_eU?t=42 | New method: https://youtu.be/Jk76IoS6qfY

Death Mountain Descent is a way to leave Death Mountain without using the cave system, with the aid of major glitches. More info here: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Death_Mountain_Descent ~ Video on mirror DMD by pinkus: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4yCXru2fltc ~ DMD video by SKUJ: https://youtu.be/MI4lSfgd_eU?t=382

EG means Exploration Glitch. The glitch allows you to walk on the incorrect layer and thereby pass through almost anything. With EG, the game can be completed within 2 minutes.
https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/File:Eg-map.png ~ Interactive EG Map: http://tloz.breitzeit.de/alttp/j1.0/underworld ~ Annotated EG Map: https://alttp-wiki.net/images/b/be/EG_map_fully_annotated.png
https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/File:EG_Strength_Map.jpg

Fake Powder is a minor glitch that allows you to use the Cane of Somaria with no magic to trick the game into allowing you to powder with the mushroom, without having to exchange it at the Witch's Hut. Example: https://clips.twitch.tv/PrettyPreciousAntelopeKeepo

Fake flippers, a glitch which allows you to swim without having the flippers. It is performed by jumping into water and changing screen just as you hit the water. Leaving the water will end the glitch, and taking damage whilst swimming can result in the infinite scroll glitch. JP v1.0 only. More info: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Fake_Flippers

Normally, saving and quitting is not allowed in this category. However, if a runner softlocks on the fakeflippers glitch, they are allowed to S+Q back to Link's House for the groups stage. During brackets, runners must return to the bush on the same screen where the glitch was performed.

Some enemies detect Link by shooting out invisible sprites in a sweeping, circular pattern. Shortbooms happen when the boomerang collides with one of these sprites before hitting the guard. You can see the sprites in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8vf7WWvOHu8

An itemdash using the hookshot. When performed properly, on the JPv1.0 version, Link will be put into the same glitched state as a spindash and can achieve superspeed.

Hovering over gaps is performed by holding the A button (for up to 29 frames), releasing it for one frame, and repressing it the next frame. ie: (Release A)(Move for one frame)(Press A)[repeat]. If the A button is held or released for too long you will fall! More info: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Hovering

By hitting both the Y-button and the A-button on the same frame, one can perform a dash where the currently equipped item is activated throughout the dash. The most commonly used itemdash is the hammerdash. JP v1.0 only. More info: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Itemdash

A keydash can be performed by initiating a dash a multiple of 4 pixels away from a locked door. Positioning yourself against an opposing wall before starting the dash, or nudging an object whilst dashing, will both automatically align you properly. More info: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Keydash

Low%: Beat the game using the minimal items required to finish the game. There are 2 main NMG variations: 3-Heart and Legacy. 3-Heart uses a minor glitch to "delete" heart containers from bosses such that you finish the run with 3 hearts. Legacy does not skip these hearts. See !3heartlow and !legacylow for more info.
Some misc maps and images showing room layouts, sprite placements, contents of chests/pots, and NPC/boss rewards: http://ian-albert.com/games/legend_of_zelda_a_link_to_the_past_maps/
MASHING THE BUTTONS IS CALLED PUMPING

A Mirror Jump involves hopping a ledge and using the Magic Mirror at the same time. The usual intended effect (on the overworld) is to shift Link's position by 1px where it would not otherwise be possible. This is most commonly applied in the Any% No EG category to rescue the frog/dwarf without the Titan's Mitts. More info here: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Mirror_Jumps

NMG is short for No Major Glitches and means that glitches that skip a large chunk of the game, such as EG and OOB, are not allowed. More information on glitch classifications can be found here: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Major_glitches
Out of Bounds (abbreviated OoB) means leaving the intended confinements of the playing field. The most powerful/broken Out of Bounds state is EG (Exploration Glitch).

Plaid World is what we call the place we get to after doing an underworld fake flute. This can be done by using blue/green YBA from inside a dungeon, house or a cave (collectivly known as "underworld"). More info: https://gist.github.com/helgefmi/6cca5f2a52de663d41b7332b116b0edc

Groups of enemies in the game have their own prize pack, meaning an ordered list of what they will drop when you kill them, if they drop something at all. Killing an enemy with a dash does not cause a drop and does not advance the prize pack. For more info, see: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Enemy_Prize_Packs

Pumping is a small movement optimization technique which saves ~10s over an Any% NMG run. There are several types (see: airpumping, stairpumping, wallpumping), but all involve attempting to reset Link's normal movement pattern such that more pixels are gained per frame. The most beneficial types of pumping are double pumping (in one-tile wide spots where Link has walls on either side) and pumping in shallow water.
Puzzle Resources: https://pastebin.com/hW877i3P ~ History: http://pastebin.com/UYHrG032

With the camera aligned to the correct horizontal pixel when initiating a mirror warp or entering a warp tile, the warp animation can be shortened by 34 frames. More info here: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Quick_Warps ~ Screenshots here: https://imgur.com/a/m1e8O

Reverse Boss Order is a category in which you defeat all bosses in the reverse order, all the way from Ganon to Armos Knights. The run ends, as usual, when collecting the Triforce. The category requires frequent use of major glitches such as EG and YBA. Route: https://bit.ly/2SEJ0zr

S+Q means Save and Quit and can be used to minimize overworld travel. With so many other categories that allow heavy sequence breaking, the community at large has decided to not allow S+Q in an NMG speedrun simply to include more content of the game that most other categories skip.
Somaria Glitches Tutorial by SuperSKUJ: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KfP3jF4sdIY

By releasing a sword spin and pressing the A-button the first frame after release, Link will be put into a glitched state and cannot use his sword. If you touch manual stairs and exit without Stair Drag canceling, Link will move at dashing speed with the ability to change directions. Just as with hookdash, pressing A, changing screens, or jumping off a ledge will end the glitched state. JP v1.0 only.
http://www.speedrun.com/alttp/guides

When exiting a staircase, Link will walk slowly for a short period of time. To prevent this, you can tap LEFT for at least 1 frame, tap A (with boots) for at least 1 frame or tap RIGHT for at least 2 frames before continuing with regular movement.

While walking on a staircase or ladder in which you still retain control of Link's movement, you can pump diagonals when walking north on them. The normal animation for climbing stairs/ladders contains a lot of 0 pixel per frame movement, so pumping these ladders to avoid such frames is very important. Even if you do no other pumping, you should incorporate stairpumping into your movement, since it saves more than just a handful of frames.
sub 8 gtower > sub 6 escape
This game uses subpixels for its movement. This is how Link gets the movement speed of 2-1-2-1 on normal ground etc. More info: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Subpixels

By having a medallion or hookshot equipped and hitting the Y-button and the A-button at the same frame (or using a spindash), you activate a glitched walking state. By climbing stairs that you can manually move up and down and exiting them without canceling Stair Drag, you will gain dash speed while walking. This activated state is called superspeed. The effect is active until canceled by pressing the A-button, taking damage, changing screen, or jumping off a ledge. JP v1.0 only. Tutorial by SuperSKUJ: https://youtu.be/Pvmi5DuR9rA
Room-by-room Swamp Tutorial by BluntBunny: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/170635873?t=01h18m48s

Sword Buffering is performed by pressing a direction and pressing B the next frame. Since using your sword will interrupt all D-Pad inputs it allows you to hold the dpad for longer than 1 frame but you move for only 1 frame if executed properly.

By holding out the sword first then performing a hookdash (itemdash with hookshot) on stairs you will be able to climb the stairs with the same speed as walking whilst holding out the sword on flat ground. If the sword spin is released before exiting the stairs, you will also have superspeed afterwards. JP v1.0 only.

An alternate rupee route for Any% NMG which skips the chests behind Saha in favor of pulling 2 trees. Done well, this route only saves ~4-5 seconds over Saha rupees. More info: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Agahnim%27s_Tower#Rupee_tree
Avoiding the trident in Ganon Phase 1 by poor_little_pinkus: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pmlsW1M6leo
https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/Trinexx

The best way to verify a 1.0 cart is to try one of the 1.0-specific glitches such as item-dashing or fake flippers. Genuine 1.0 carts will have a 2-digit number on the back. Letters indicate patched versions (A=1.1, B=1.2). Reference pic: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/File:1.0-cart-back.jpg | Chipset reference: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/File:SHVC-ZL-0-pcb-front-9146.jpg

A technique that optimizes Link's walking pattern. When walking cardinally to the west or north, Link's movement begins on the 2 pixel speed, and changes to the directional input will reset his movement speed back to the beginning of the sequence. Therefore, if walking north or west along a wall, you can mash diagonals into the wall to repeatedly reset Link's movement to the 2 pixel speed and avoid the slower 1 pixel speed in the sequence.

Yuzuhara's Bottle Adventure (YBA) is a glitch that involves using a potion the same frame as you initiate a screen transition to manipulate the memory. Different locations and potions can have different effects such as screen warps or accessing the flute menu without actually having the flute (even in the dark world).

RMG stands for "Restricted Major Glitches" and refers to a subset of major glitches that are banned for the ruleset. The following set of glitches are NOT allowed in this ruleset: Exploration Glitch, Door Glitches, Wrong Warps, and Misslotting. This ruleset exists as a friendly bridge between No Major Glitches and Unrestricted (All Major Glitches).

ACE stands for "Arbitrary Code Execution". It is possible to do this during a realtime run: https://alttp-wiki.net/index.php/ACE_RTA

If you die in a Dark World dungeon without beating Aga 1, your world variable will be switched to Light World. This creates a conflict that we call "Fake Dark World" which can result in some undesirable effects like boss crystals not dropping (if their corresponding LW dungeon has been completed) or putting you in LW after a screen transition. These can be resolved by mirroring in the overworld.

While moving on manual staircases, Link moves slower than normal. At the end of these stairs, you can restore Link's normal speed earlier than usual by tapping LEFT for at least 1 frame, tapping A (with boots) for at least 1 frame or by tapping RIGHT for at least 2 frames. Optimally, this can save 9 or 10 frames per manual staircase exit. (Note: You won't be able to get superspeed if you cancel stair drag)

Agahnim 2's attacks repeat in a Y-B-B-Y pattern where Y stands for a guaranteed yellow (energy) ball and B stands for a 50/50 chance to be either an energy or a blue ball.

ALTTP Speedrunning officially allows SNES9X (versions greater than 1.43) and BSNES - Official snes9x download site: https://github.com/snes9xgit/snes9x/releases - official bsnes download site: https://github.com/bsnes-emu/bsnes/releases - You may also use the snes9x and bsnes cores in retroarch (https://retroarch.com) but this requires customization beyond what you may be able to get help with in this discord.

Buane's gentle voice resonated in the serene mediation temple he was streaming in. Far off, the harmonious thrum of a prayer-bowl and a Buddhist temple bell could be heard. "Triumph through gentleness, not strength" he murmured, his pleasant chocolate baritone soothing the nerves of his audience. "True victory is kindness. Wrath and desire are paths towards defeat" he explained. He breathed deeply, aligning his chakras before entering the Agahnim fight.

GDO is short for Glitchless Dungeon Order which is a category designed to play the game in the order suggested by the developers following the dungeons in order and utilizing none of the major or minor glitches. Rules: https://tinyurl.com/GDOsrc | Guide: https://tinyurl.com/GDOguide
